page.title: 09Orton Longueville Hall
page.content: Orton Hall is in the Village of Orton Longueville, in the city of Peterborough. Its interesting external features include landscaped grounds with 100 year old Wellingtonia trees, castleated towers and gargoyles. It also has little decorated archways. It is now a school for Educationally sub-normal girls, some of who board at the school. It has some interesting history in it. Marquis Huntley used to own the hall. He was a gambling man and his office had two front doors and two back doors, so that when someone came to collect a debt, he could escape by one of the other three doors and confuse them. The site is very old and the dining room has, under a protective wooden floor, a roman mosaic floor. This room also has coats of arms in stained glass.
